title:
Deformation rigidity for projective manifolds and isotriviality of
  smooth families over curves
abstract:
Let $\pi\colon X\to \Delta$ be a proper smooth K\"ahler morphism from a
complex manifold $X$ to the unit disc $\Delta$. Suppose the fibers
$X_t=\pi^{-1}(t)$ are biholomorphic to $S$ for all $t\neq0$, where $S$ is a
given projective manifold. If the canonical line bundle of $S$ is semiample,
then we show that the central fiber $X_0$ is also biholomorphic to $S$. As an
application, we obtain that, for smooth families over projective curves
satisfying that the canonical line bundle of the generic fiber is semiample,
birational isotriviality equals to isotriviality. Moreover, we also obtain a
new Parshin-Arakelov type isotriviality criterion.
